import React from "react"; import mppHomeStyles from "./../../../styles/mppNav/mppHome.scss"; // import about15 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/about/about15.png"; import about16 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/about/about16.png"; // import home from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/home/home"; import home1 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/home/home1.png"; import home2 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/home/home2.png"; import home3 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/home/home3.png"; import home4 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/home/home4.png"; import home5 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/home/home5.jpeg"; import home6 from "./../../../../../svg/mpp/home/home6.png"; import one from "./../../../../../svg/one.png"; // import two from "./../../../../../svg/two.png"; // import three from "./../../../../../svg/three.png"; {/*
*/} const MppHomePage = () => (
CREATING MPP - THE PROCESS
Home Page
SKETCHES
FINAL PRODUCT
THE PIECES
I was tasked with coming up with four graphics to represent the four parts of Medicare; Part A, Part B, Part D, and DMEPOS. When hovering over the graphic, I also created CSS animations. To create these I used Affinity Designer (similar to Adobe Illustrator), and for the animations, I used CSS.
For the animations, I took apart the graphics with layers, like so:
image
Here is a sample of the CSS animation. By moving the seperate parts of the graphic, you can easily manipulate the graphic to move one way on hover, and then reverse the movement when mousing off.
code sample
For PartA, I created an IV bag graphic, the animation was for the IV bag to fill up and drain on/off hover.
For Part B, I created a Hospital graphic, on/off hover the doors of the hospital would open and people would walk left and right.
For Part D, I created a Pill graphic, which on hover would spin one way, and off hover would spin the opposite way.
For DMEPOS, I created a Syringe graphic, which on/off hover would fill/empty with liquid.
); export default MppHomePage;
